df-pj
blocks.content: Define orthogonal projection onto a subspace. This is just a wrapping of ~ df-pj1 , but we restrict the domain of this function to only total projection functions. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Oct-2015.)

blocks.name: df-hil
blocks.content: Define class of all Hilbert spaces. Based on Proposition 4.5, p. 176, Gudrun Kalmbach, Quantum Measures and Spaces, Kluwer, Dordrecht, 1998. (Contributed by NM, 7-Oct-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 16-Oct-2015.)

blocks.name: df-obs
blocks.content: Define the set of all orthonormal bases for a pre-Hilbert space. An orthonormal basis is a set of mutually orthogonal vectors with norm 1 and such that the linear span is dense in the whole space. (As this is an "algebraic" definition, before we have topology available, we express this denseness by saying that the double orthocomplement is the whole space, or equivalently, the single orthocomplement is trivial.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 23-Oct-2015.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-obs(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wceq(cobs, cmpt(s0, cphl, crab(s1, cpw(cfv(cbs, cv(s0))), wa(wral(s2, cv(s1), wral(s3, cv(s1), wceq(co(cv(s2), cfv(cip, cv(s0)), cv(s3)), cif(cfv(cur, cfv(csca, cv(s0))), cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, cv(s0))), wceq(cv(s2), cv(s3)))))), wceq(cfv(cfv(cocv, cv(s0)), cv(s1)), csn(cfv(c0g, cv(s0))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-obs(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  ‚ä¢ OBasis =(s0 ‚àà PreHil ‚Ü¶ { s1 ‚àà P((Base ` s0))|(‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà s1, ‚àÄ(s3 ‚àà s1,(s2[(¬∑ ` s0)]s3)= if(s2 = s3,(1r `(Scalar ` s0)),(0 `(Scalar ` s0)))))‚àß((ocv ` s0)` s1)= {(0 ` s0)})})
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
}

  syl6eqr((Base ` hs0), c4, (Base ` c5), hs0 = c5)
  fveq2(hs0, c5, cbs)
  df-pj(hs0, s0)
  ssexi(((s0 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶(s0[c2](c3 ` s0)))‚ãÇ(ùïå √ó(c4[‚Ü¶]c4))), ((c1 ‚ãÇ ùïå)√ó(ùïå ‚ãÇ(c4[‚Ü¶]c4))))
  xpex((c1 ‚ãÇ ùïå), (ùïå ‚ãÇ(c4[‚Ü¶]c4)))

  fvprc(c5, cpj)

  syl5eq(c1, emptycls, (LSubSp ` c5), ¬¨ c5 ‚àà ùïå)

blocks.name: pjdm
blocks.content: A subspace is in the domain of the projection function iff the subspace admits a projection decomposition of the whole space. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Oct-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm pjdm(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, cdm(c1)), wa(wcel(c0, c2), wf(co(c0, c3, cfv(c4, c0)), c5, c5)))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cbs, c6))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(clss, c6))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cocv, c6))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cpj1, c6))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cpj, c6))
} = {
  elrab2(hs0, c0, cdm(c1), c2, wf(co(c0, c3, cfv(c4, c0)), c5, c5), wcel(co(cv(hs0), c3, cfv(c4, cv(hs0))), co(c5, cmap, c5)))
  syl6bb(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(co(cv(hs0), c3, cfv(c4, cv(hs0))), co(c5, cmap, c5)), wf(co(c0, c3, cfv(c4, c0)), c5, c5), wcel(co(c0, c3, cfv(c4, c0)), co(c5, cmap, c5)))
  eleq1d(co(cv(hs0), c3, cfv(c4, cv(hs0))), co(c5, cmap, c5), co(c0, c3, cfv(c4, c0)), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  oveq12d(cv(hs0), c3, cfv(c4, cv(hs0)), c0, cfv(c4, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  id(wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c0, c4)
  elmap(co(c0, c3, cfv(c4, c0)), c5, c5)
  fvexi(c5, cbs, c6)
  eqtri(cdm(c1), crab(hs0, c2, wcel(co(cv(hs0), c3, cfv(c4, cv(hs0))), co(c5, cmap, c5))), cima(ccnv(cmpt(hs0, c2, co(cv(hs0), c3, cfv(c4, cv(hs0))))), co(c5, cmap, c5)))

thm pjcss(class c0, class c1, class c2) {

  syl5sseqr(cfv(cfv(cocv, c0), cfv(cfv(cocv, c0), cv(hs0))), co(cv(hs0), cfv(clsm, c0), cfv(cfv(cocv, c0), cv(hs0))), cfv(cbs, c0), wa(wcel(c0, cphl), wcel(cv(hs0), cdm(c1))))
  ocvss(cfv(cocv, c0), cfv(cfv(cocv, c0), cv(hs0)), cfv(cbs, c0), c0)
  simplbda(wcel(c0, cphl), wcel(cv(hs0), cdm(c1)), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(clsm, c0), cfv(cfv(cocv, c0), cv(hs0))), cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(clss, c0)))
  pjdm2(c0, cv(hs0), c1, cfv(clss, c0), cfv(clsm, c0), cfv(cocv, c0), cfv(cbs, c0))

blocks.name: ishil
blocks.content: The predicate "is a Hilbert space" (over a *-division ring). A Hilbert space is a pre-Hilbert space such that all closed subspaces have a projection decomposition. (Contributed by NM, 7-Oct-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 22-Jun-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm ishil(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, chil), wa(wcel(c0, cphl), wceq(cdm(c1), c2)))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cpj, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(ccss, c0))
} = {
  elrab2(hs0, c0, chil, cphl, wceq(cdm(c1), c2), wceq(cdm(cfv(cpj, cv(hs0))), cfv(ccss, cv(hs0))))
  eqeq12d(cdm(cfv(cpj, cv(hs0))), cfv(ccss, cv(hs0)), cdm(c1), c2, wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  dmeqd(cfv(cpj, cv(hs0)), c1, wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  syl6eqr(cfv(cpj, cv(hs0)), c1, cfv(cpj, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c0, cpj)
  syl6eqr(cfv(ccss, cv(hs0)), c2, cfv(ccss, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c0, ccss)
  df-hil(hs0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cphl)
  diff.hs0.w(wceq(cdm(c1), c2))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm ishil(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà Hil ‚Üî(c0 ‚àà PreHil ‚àß dom(c1)= c2))
  ‚ä£ c1 =(proj ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c2 =(ClSubSp ` c0)
} = {
  elrab2(hs0, c0, chil, cphl, dom(c1)= c2, dom((proj ` hs0))=(ClSubSp ` hs0))
  eqeq12d(dom((proj ` hs0)), (ClSubSp ` hs0), dom(c1), c2, hs0 = c0)
  dmeqd((proj ` hs0), c1, hs0 = c0)
  syl6eqr((proj ` hs0), c1, (proj ` c0), hs0 = c0)
  fveq2(hs0, c0, cpj)
  syl6eqr((ClSubSp ` hs0), c2, (ClSubSp ` c0), hs0 = c0)
  fveq2(hs0, c0, ccss)
  df-hil(hs0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cphl)
  diff.hs0.w(dom(c1)= c2)
